metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3488 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Processing of repeated responses to the same query, where both responses contain ECS pseudo-options, but where the first is broken in some way, can cause BIND to exit with an assertion failure. 'Broken' in this context is anything that would cause the resolver to reject the query response, such as a mismatch between query and answer name. This issue affects BIND 9 versions 9.11.4-S1 through 9.11.37-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 through 9.16.36-S1.

notes.Note: alexmurray> As of isc-dhcp-4.4.3-1, isc-dhcp vendors bind9 libs litios> This vulnerability only affects Supported Preview versions

criterions.comment: bind9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
